title: Jungle Tax- An Explanation/Discussion
body:
Okay so this is an issue I see alot in low/mid elo. Jungle tax. Let's start by defining jungle tax, it is the act of taking 1-3 minions for a successful gank.

Do's: 

-Tax for successful ganks. Blowing a major summoner (flash ideally, TP, basically anything that isn't a 2 minute CD)

-Take 1-3 minions for your time investment if you do NOT get the kill.

-Ask if your laner dies if they want you to shove or freeze (if lane is freezeable)

-If laner asks you to freeze ONLY last hit the minions. 

-Generally you are safe to push the wave into tower, however if your laner pings you to stop, just last hit until they are back into lane (no point in wasting xp and gold).

Don'ts:

-Tax the cannon minion, that is 50 gold, essentially the same gold you would get from taxing 1-3 minions. This actually hurts your laner.

-Tax without a successful gank, this only hurts your lane especially if they are even/a little ahead, you were most likely already getting xp setting them back on experience and depending on timing that could really hurt the lane (usually pre 6 taking xp is potentially a death sentence).

-Tax when you take the kill. You just earned 200 gold and xp for a kill, do not deny your laner gold unless they need help pushing the wave to tower. Then you are not taxing but pushing (a difference ignored far too much).

-Push the lane when your laner asks (or pings danger when you try to push). Usually this means they need/want to freeze. Keep in mind a frozen lane also forces the enemy to extend more, giving you a return gank opportunity. 

-Tax more than 3 minions, this is something I see very often at lower elo, JGs taxing a full wave. When you do that not only did you share xp (helping you out and hurting the lane slightly) you have taken 21x3+3x19+40(+0.5 gold per 90 seconds of game timer, according to LoLWikia). Meaning you just took 63+ 57+40= 160 gold. That is nearly the total of a kill, so if you tax a full wave and gave your lane a kill you essentially wiped the advantage you gave.

-Do NOT tax a losing lane, even if you successfully gank. The lane is behind and hurting, do not take more xp than absolutely necessary and definitely do not take gold that they so desperately need.


These are my general concepts for taxing as a jungler. I know alot of things were restated, primarily to try to emphasize the point. Comment below anything you think I missed or didn't explain properly.

replies.body: I've had junglers come out of the bush/river and just starting "taxing" cs. And I've even had people say it was for their "presence" I didn't even think explaining that presence means the enemy knows which lane to gank now or even which part of your jungle to invade was worth it.

This is alot of the point of the guide. This account is in very low elo and I see it alot. Taxing is a completely necessary thing however there are ways to do it properly without hurting your lanes. If you gank get the kill and tax you have essentially took 400g away from your lane for example. There are lots of examples of poor taxing, which is why I wanted to post this thread, to be a guide for junglers to know how/when to tax.

On the flip side, I've had junglers that were struggling, and behind, and even though they weren't really at the right lvl/max hp to gank, they'd still try. I'd try to let them get some CS from my wave intentionally to help them catch up. Most often they are pretty grateful and think that's neat, and I'm glad. How do you expect your jungler to gank, or gank well, if they are 3 lvls behind? Plus donating cs to help your jungler means they're probably gonna gank you first when are able to, and are gonna generously commit to it. 

But sometimes they won't take the cs. I'll even ask them if they'd like me to leave lane and help them with gromp, but sometimes I think it's pride maybe? A jungler won't take my help, or maybe they've been chewed out before for taxing and have grown reluctant or not willing to do so.  I do think there is a stigma regarding it, thanks for helping to clear this up for folks.

In regards to Jg falling behind in xp, generally means they weren't holding lanes while somoene backed, losing XP and gold for themselves, while as a JG you won't have the same level as your solo laners you shouldn't be 3 levels down, if youa re it means the game is falling apart or you are not eating the free xp when it is there.

That feeling when you crawl out of the jungle to gobble up a few minions under your turret for some XP and Gold and your laner cracks the whip and yells at you:

"P-ppleease sir, may I have another? I was just h-hungry!" 

Yet they are no where near the turret and those minion xp/gold is just gonna evaporate bc it's not like our turrets gain XP for killing minions (lol?) It's like a balance between knowing when it's ok to "tax" or "sponge" a lane and when it's not. But it's also not all up to the jungler, it's also his or her laner's responsibility to also be aware of when it is healthy and when it isn't and to allow or remind the jungler of such. It can be very opressing to have a laner bark at you to go away just bc they are , say, Nasus, and don't want to miss *any* stacks so just go away.

You don't even make it back to your next camp before you try to tell Nasus to back, and he dies to a gank and suddenly it's your fault to leaving/not staying around to help/told to leave/sorta don't wanna help this guy. It puts a huge chip on the jungler's should and starts negativity creep.

This ties into the other main post I have, basically one of the key points is whenever anything toxic happens I type /mute all and will type hey we need to do drake, because they can hear you but not the other way around. It isn't worth exposing yourself to toxic/assholes. It is after all a game, if you aren't enjoying it there is zero reason to play, or even to try to do well because they ruined your time so you are probably done for the night.

*Did you know, typing /mute all still allows other players to see your posts if they don't have you muted?*

Would be a nice lil load screen/start of game tidbit for them to code in.

No because they don't want to encourage /mute all this is a game based entirely on working together, muting everyone would hinder that. As a general rule though pings should be used almost exclusively for communication. 3 to suggest 5 to demand.

This is highly debatable but it is true that it hurts the lane. Expecially top lane where it is 2v1 and I am the jung. I don't always get a tank that is good about cs under tower that has fed the enemy tanks a few times. His lane is now a losing lane but I never give up on the tank so I do my best to hurt the when I can but they both ward very well meaning I can't get a kill with my tank also behind. This way all I can do is help freeze the lane so he can cs the minions. After the wave is clear I run to the gromp or golems and kill them before coming back to tax 2 minions since the enemy tanks would have shown up by then.

P.S. I know this may open up bot lane to attack but if enemy is duo top then I shouldn't have to worry. If top lane is still feeding then I will just have to do my jung and their jung till i can catch up and run bot and mid for ganks leaving top as a distraction. 

This isn't very effective since I found that I played into the enemy trap. Sometimes they won't run a jung to bully my tank so I have no time to jung.

Ive covered my fair share of lanes as a jungler. While i might not be able to get up there and get the CS because of death possibility, I can def. soak up all the XP at the turret.

It sounds like you are more worried about the gold income than XP. Again, I think you are blowing this whole weak jungler thing out of proportion. My last game I was playing jungle. Jungle Shyv. My mid Ahri roamed quite a bit. I would just run into the lane and shove it in everytime she left, or take all the CS at the turret and move on. I didnt tax any lanes. I also did more than fine. Because, there is always farm to get at any point, without having to ruin your laner's lane while they are in it. 

I just think you are over-exagerrating how far behind junglers fall; esp. in solo Q.

It really has nothing to do with them falling behind, the whole premise of tax is to make not only the laner stronger (even in case of blown flash they now have better lane presence because the enemy has to play safer or die to gank or all in) but also the JG. Basically instead of one guy running at you with full plate armor a big ass sword and a buddy who is wearing parts of a chain vest and a much smaller sword. You have 2 guys with more equal gear, meaning that if one dies the whole plan doesn't go to shit because holy crap they focused the guy with the armor and sword now what do I do. It is very little about being behind but more of sharing the wealth. This is a team game, if as whole the team is stronger, it benefits everyone. If you are just a little bit stronger, more depends on you never dying. It is basically investing in the fact that you may mess up and die at some point, meaning someone else has to pick up the slack, now who do you want to pick up the slack old half a chain vest and a long sword? or a plate chested chain mail the rest of him with a decent sized sword? Personally I pick option 2

Also this is great that you were able to cover lanes consistently, but it again is not something that is a certainty, example had your mid been a Xerath it is very risky for Xerath to roam, so he typically doesn't which would actually be hurting you because that is gold you are sort of depending on.

I only tax when my laner is "that" laner.

You know who i'm talking about, that guy who is shoving his lane at all times yet is getting at most 2 minions per wave. No point in letting cs go to waste because someone has no idea how to time his last hits. I do the same when i'm a support in that situation.

I get teammates like this all the time in bronze5.
This is something I have seen an almost comical amount if it wasn't at the same time so very sad to see

Don'ts as a jungler:
don't tax ever. All it does is put your laner behind, punishing them for you ganking.

Do's as a jungler:
Push the lane after a successful gank  in order to press the advantage you gained by denying your own creeps to the enemy tower and by potentially taking the tower.

Seriously,  bad junglers tax because they see higher elo junglers killing creeps but they don't realize it is to push and not to "tax"

So your theory is that regardless of giving time and kills to the lane you should take zero gold as a JG? Well that works real fine if your lane is a 100% will not lose carry, however that player does not exist, taxing is there for a reason. Taking 3 minions doesn't hurt the lane, 63 gold at most (if you follow the above rule of not taxing a cannon minion). If you as a laner will not trade up to 63 gold for your JG blowing your lanes flash (giving you kill pressure or giving you enough breathing room to farm) then you should probably rethink alot of your thought process. Now taxing lanes that are behind is not something that should be done however all of that is very plainly laid out above. Good to know jungle assistance is not something you feel is worth 64 gold.

> [{quoted}](name=Mezzie,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=yKYo0eNh,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-03-01T01:14:56.839+0000)
>
> So your theory is that regardless of giving time and kills to the lane you should take zero gold as a JG?

No. You should push the lane after getting a kill. You walk away with either kill or assist gold  as well as several creeps because pushing involves killing creeps.

>Taking 3 minions doesn't hurt the lane, 63 gold at most 

And 3 creeps worth of exp. falling behind for that short bit can easily make you lose lane if you're playing against a competant player.
"Taxing is there for a reason" It only exists in bronze.

> If you as a laner will not trade up to 63 gold for your JG blowing your lanes flash (giving you kill pressure or giving you enough breathing room to farm) then you should probably rethink alot of your thought process. 

If I'm playing against a riven who hits 6 before I do because you sap exp, I'd sure as hell rather you not gank at all than to tax my lane and let her win easily.

>Good to know jungle assistance is not something you feel is worth 64 gold.

This is a team game, the best way to win is to put money on your laners. The whole reason champions are good at jungling is because they can be super effective while on a minimum gold income. If that 64 gold is worth setting your laner behind you should probably stop junging and learn how to win.

Yes in the Riven case there are specific instances that this can change. However if you are burning summoners and making them leave lane (when taxing is viable) you have the XP advantage, so you can afford to share some xp and be fine, Also on your way back to lane while you wait for the lane to push you can eat golems (again relevant to level/items) None of which actually ruin a lane. If you are losing lane because of tax there is most likely another major issue costing you and not the small xp/gold loss. Now I will say in some matchups they are so bad you need every single advantage you can have, as with every rule there are exceptions

However if you are burning summoners and making them leave lane (when taxing is viable) you have the XP advantage, so you can afford to share some xp and be fine, Also on your way back to lane while you wait for the lane to push you can eat golems (again relevant to level/items) None of which actually ruin a lane. If you are losing lane because of tax there is most likely another major issue costing you and not the small xp/gold loss. Now I will say in some matchups they are so bad you need every single advantage you can have, as with every rule there are exceptions


I specifically said to push if you get a successful gank. If you force the opponent out of lane then you SHOULD push to deny the enemy gold and exp. This isn't taxing, this is strategic pushing. Also viable if the enemy laner is a champion who has trouble last hitting under tower to some extent.
If all you do is make them burn a summoner without putting them in a passive position (ie low enough that they can be easily zoned) or making them back, taking exp will only make your ally vulnerable when the enemy gets a temporarily level advantage.
This isn't limited to riven. Any toplaner who has kill potential can easily all in you at 6 when you`re 5 because your jungler sapped exp.
At higher elos people will push whatever advantage they can, people know how to play aggro.

There is no correct time to tax for the sake of taxing.

Where in this does it say tax to tax? It actually says don't but hey please continue to make arguments as most of them are in extremely specific scenarios that don;t come up every gank. But please continue to try to discredit something simply because you don't like it or understand it is a general guide. Have a nice day I am actually done talking to you. 

Also if with summoner advantage you can't zone that is on YOU not the jungler, therefore they earned their tax. It is your play that is not punishing them.

> This is a team game, the best way to win is to put money on your laners. The whole reason champions are good at jungling is because they can be super effective while on a minimum gold income. If that 64 gold is worth setting your laner behind you should probably stop junging and learn how to win.

Thought I would throw this in since I am reading other comments. If it is, as you stated a TEAM game and the TEAM would benefit from more people being ahead, smaller leads individually but more people ahead, why exactly are you against a JG taxing? Thinking purely off the xp and gold from an assist you would expect to be 2 camps up from the enemy JG. Now given that ganks rarely take less than 20 seconds, you can expect that by around level 4 the enemy JG to clear a camp and begin the next one in roughly 8 seconds. Now that is 16 seconds+ walk time(say 4 seconds for simple math) so 20 seconds total. Now factor in a gank typically has a set up time 5-10 seconds the actual gank another 5 seconds, time for tax +5 seconds and then the walk to the nearest not cleared camp, say top lane gank Golems would likely have been cleared before the gank leaving raptors up possibly wolves? Cannot depend on counter JG as you don't know what was cleared in the past minute or where the enemy is. Now adding all that together you get 10 for set up 5 for gank 5 for tax and probably another 8-10 to get to a camp you can clear, 28-30 seconds, well that would put you about 3 camps behind, where as you gained from the assist and XP from kill MAYBE 2 camps of xp.

All the math aside, you argue for the team factor, which is true this is a team game. However is the jungler not part of the team? Is them being ahead not also beneficial? Yes gold on laners is nice, however you now have xp and gold advantage as laner, you should be fine without JG assistance, meaning while you snowball he no longer gets that assist and XP from kill because you can now solo kill or 2v2 in bot lanes case, meaning now that he is equal footing to the enemy JG your team now has a glaring weakspot. The jungler doesn't have the money to buy the items he needs, so maybe instead of front lining like he may have been capable of with a small gold boost he dies and the fight goes a little bit sideways. Ganks are to put the TEAM ahead, as long as the jungler is on the team he should receive more reward than "ok you can be at the same spot had you kept power farming".


Apologies if this came off as condescending or anything I just really fail to see why people are so against letting the jungler tax. Yes some JGs tax too much, some just leech XP, some don't tax and fall behind. If we can get more JGs to tax to an acceptable level for laners (to not set them behind, IE taking a cannon and 2 more creeps) there is actually no VALID issue to be against taxing. Atleast not that I can see, again there are specific exceptions, however this is a general guide and not a law, there are times where the general rule is wrong, it is great you pointed some of those out. But I do feelt he need to reiterate I apologize for coming off as hostile, it had little to do with the posts on the board but the in game messages I was getting from people who...failed to understand this as a general guide or took me as someone they could rant to about their JG taxing ruined their lane.



POST EDIT: Failed to comment on the fact "junglers are junglers because they can do well on less gold"

Yes there is some truth to this, however if they can survive on less gold, wouldn't throwing them 63 gold be like showering them in wealth? Think about the time the JG spent waiting in the bush to gank for you, he probably could have cleared atleast one camp in that time, tax is not only for successful ganks but think of it as a thank you for time invested previously when a gank didn't work (no gold went to the JG because of flash or laner backed or just a good escape by the enemy) that was also timed invested where they weren't gaining gold, not necessarily because their own play, you might have misplayed the set up, you might not have cleared the bush of wards, you might have called for help when they were trying to back. All of these things happen in the course of a game, but it is all time/gold that the JG does not get back freely. This in my mind is the core behind the taxing system, not for the ganks where you got gold, but for when things didn't work for whatever reason, because when ganks don't work the JG just fell behind for no reason, now maybe he loses that 1v1 because he is down the last item component he was 100G short of.

You do know that you are low elo too, right? And here you are trying to justify taxing your teammates for doing your job as a jungler, which honestly, is toxic. Mainly, because you dont know what the hell you are doing, and just tax stupidly because you showed up to their lane like Jesus and deserve it.

If you are that far behind that you need to consistently tax every lane you show up to, then you are playing jungle pretty poorly. I gave you the only 3 reasons you should be taking CS. And, you should be covering a lane and not afking your camps all day, which will make up for any "tax" you feel like you need to take.

Its honestly sad that you think you actually need to tax any lane you show up to. It really is. There is no such thing as jungle tax. If you are taxing a lane simply because you showed up, its because you are just an asshole, bottom line. 

Taxing lanes just because you attempted a gank is a low elo move and mentality, so sir, you keep catering to yourself.

And, taxing a lane pushes the lane. People dont always want their lane pushed. If you chunk the enemy enough, they can completely zone them off the wave for quite awhile, but with some jungler like you killing half the wave and pushing it, that cant happen. Again, if the guy wants to push or to back, then help him. But dont take 3-4 minions just becuase you show up, when he might want the wave exactly where its at. But hey, you are the jungling master.

Did you actually read any of this? Oh and by the way feel free to check my match history, not a jungler, on any of my accounts, so exactly how am I trying to justify taxing a lane when I don't jungle? I believe i have one ranked JG game in my last 20? Normals I generally play with friends and fuck around do whatever (alot of JG but very little seriousness, IE joking around, not really doing much, not taxing just enjoying time with frineds). 

As has now been stated many many times, taxing a lane is not pushing, if you wait and last hit 3 minions you didn't push (assuming you last hit properly at the last second).

Thank you for calling me the jungling master by the way, especially funny when I don't play the role, real top notch insults there. Just a bit of a tip, next time you are gonna try to insult someone and discredit them, do your research first, there are only about 2 dozen sites to check what role someone plays the most before you go shooting out "You just saying that because you wanna tax cause you play Jungle".

Sincerely,
 
     A Riven Main (that's top lane BTW not Jungle) xD

I think lane taxing a lane is mostly common sense. If you are there and there is cs that your laner isn't going to get, you can take it. If you are pushing tower, then you don't worry have to worry about overtaxing.
Neither of those are taxing though. Taxing is specific to ganking for a lane and taking farm (not pushing to tower). Pushing to a tower is different.
Then I guess it's never really appropriate to tax a lane then.

Taxing a lane is merely last hitting 1-3 minions, you don't want to spam AA or abilities because maybe your laner needed to freeze for a few hundred gold for a item powerspike. That is what I personally would call pushing a lane, trying to shove it to tower, however if you get a successful gank off you can choose not to tax (not something I recommend because while you invested time you fell behind the enemy JG and the 2-3 camps they most likely cleared) so taxing is really just making sure one persons lead turns into leads for multiple people. because off the XP of kill and the assist gold you come out about equal to the enemy JG (assuming they are farming and not in base/dead etc.). So if as a laner I can sacrifice up to 3 minions to put my Jg ahead in gold and xp it is worth it. Does this mean there are times you should not take a tax? Absolutely and I feel I listed a fair amount if not all of the times (barring very specific things like we are both 2 minions short of 6 and if you take XP you signed a death warrant for me) but those come up maybe once a game. This is a general guide for taxing, by no means if it a law.


But back to original point you can tax while pushing a lane but taxing is when your laner is alive, pushing is either they need to shove to B or they are dead, these are just my uses of the terms, everyone may have different mindsets on the exact definitions.

> Taxing a lane is merely last hitting 1-3 minions.

I was using your definition of taxing when I said it was never appropriate.

>...because off the XP of kill and the assist gold you come out about equal to the enemy JG (assuming they are farming and not in base/dead etc.). So if as a laner I can sacrifice up to 3 minions to put my Jg ahead in gold and xp it is worth it.

As you said, the gold and XP off of a successful kill, tends to put a jungler even or better with a jungler who farmed instead. By taxing, you get two people ahead.

If you don't lane tax (and assuming your ally is skilled), you stay caught up, your ally gets fed, and they shut down the enemy laner. That fed person can then take over the entire game. ADCs, midlaners, and even most tops, yes even the tanky tops, can each take over an entire game if they play right.

So would you rather have two people be ahead, or have one person be fed and have an enemy shut down?

At the same time 63 gold (assuming you take 3 mellee minions) doesn't stop the laner from being fed, they have the ability to snowball the lane because of the +300 for the kill they just got an XP bonus. Where as the 63 gold is another ward for the JG 2 more pots to get off more ganks. Or in the course of the game say they tax each lane once, that's 180g, use that to invest into ward control for an objective. I have never seen a laner not snowball because of 60 gold, most laners when trying to shove a lane will miss 3 minions trying to put it into tower. I think the arguments against this are way overvaluing the 60 gold for a lane. You get a fresh 200ish gold every 30 seconds coming to you. The JG does not, especially considering about 10 minutes inot the game the mid lane will eat either wolves or raptors...hurting JG gold flow.


Also I direct you to another analogy I have made. rather have one guy in full plate armor and a big ass sword followed by someone in parts of a chain vest and a short sword or both in a plate chest with chain armor on their arms and legs with moderately sized swords. The point of this is it is less on one person to win the game, yes he is not as strong as he could be but he also has support, if he dies the fight can still go on.


Also with getting an assist you come out about equal on gold with the enemy JG, assuming they are farming (safe assumption most the time) but most ganks invest more time than camp clearing, so between time and gold the JG is actually slightly behind, the extra 63 gold is what makes a gank equal (assuming solo lane gank and not bot, bot 2 assists would put the ganking JG ahead by about 2 camps worth of xp and equal on gold).

At the same time 63 gold (assuming you take 3 mellee minions) doesn't stop the laner from being fed, they have the ability to snowball the lane because of the +300 for the kill they just got an XP bonus. Where as the 63 gold is another ward for the JG 2 more pots to get off more ganks. Or in the course of the game say they tax each lane once, that's 180g, use that to invest into ward control for an objective. I have never seen a laner not snowball because of 60 gold, most laners when trying to shove a lane will miss 3 minions trying to put it into tower. I think the arguments against this are way overvaluing the 60 gold for a lane. You get a fresh 200ish gold every 30 seconds coming to you. The JG does not, especially considering about 10 minutes inot the game the mid lane will eat either wolves or raptors...hurting JG gold flow.

Why the hell would you be waiting around in a lane waiting to last hit 3 minions? What a waste of time. So, sitting in a lane for 15+ seconds to last hit 3 minions is a better use of your time than just heading to the next camp or lane? You might as well just shove the lane in that amount of time, if you are going to sit around waiting to last hit minions.

I dont get it anyways. Unless you ran full speed into the lane, you probably leeched some xp sitting in the bush waiting to gank. So, then you sit around for another large chunk of time to last hit 3 minions, too?

Again, before you sit in a lane fighting for CS against someone who is probably goint to try and to last hit those same minions, you might as well just shove the wave into the turret.

Taxing is dumb because its just a waste. You either shove the wave, or leave. I wouldnt even shove the wave unless the people you ganked died, or your laner needs to back. 

lol sitting around in a lane waiting to last hit minions, which means you are going to be fighting for the same CS against the laner, which means you might even make each other miss them.

Assuming that you didn't time the gank in some miracle timing where no abilities touched minions they aren't going to be full HP, most likely 2-3 of them are going to be at the point where they can be last hit, taking those is what it is referring to.

I really just don't see the point of your argument, you seem to simply restate taxing is dumb without providing actual reasons as to why you believe it is dumb? If you are waiting for an additional 15 seconds to hit 3 minions then you are probably brain dead, just because I said don't AA them to death (something that interferes with your laner) doesn't mean type /dance and wait. If by some miracle the minions are all healthy and you aren't pushing the wave yes then you shouldn't wait for 20 seconds to get 60ish gold.

If you believe that truly everytime you gank to take 3 minions without pushing the wave would take longer than 5 seconds you should probably submit a video because that is truly an amazing feat. You are the kind of guy to take a general guide and nitpick because you disagree with every insanely unlikely scenario that comes to mind. Please tell me where in this guide I say "Do this every time you gank regardless of time investment or anything cause hahaha" I would love to see that. Instead you bring up arguments, which some are valid, but are also answered by common sense. This isn't a guide for every exact situation as you seem to want to make it. It is a page of guidelines to taxing a lane.


Also if 2 people are trying to last hit the same minions and nobody gets the gold, there is a much bigger issue than "Should the JG have taxed"

You shouldnt have to tax a lane. Also, lets make sure we are talking about laning phase, and not 20 minutes into the game when towers are down and laning phase is over. Its ok to take minions then. Just push waves. Also, again, at various points in the game, there are going to be open lanes you can go to. Mid roams? cover mid. Top backs? Cover top. Again, one of the biggest issues I see in my elo is junglers do not cover lanes. They will prioritize a wolf camp over 2 waves crashing into mid turret, or an empty mid lane they could push into the turret. 

People are against jungler tax because its not needed, and is mostly an asshole move.

Those are valid points, however considering JG hp, sometimes going to cover a lane is more suicidal than a solo baron at 20. I have had people complain I didn't cover a lane when I knew going there was basically waving HI and dying to their laner. That is another key point of tax, while tax can be secured with a good gank, a lane cover cannot be guaranteed, hell maybe mid roamed bot to turn a gank into a 4 man death from holy crap there are 4 people in my lane. These are all completely valid arguments, and I apologize I got a bit...agitated over people disagreeing, less the disagreeing but some of the phrasing for the disagreement. As a jungler, I don't see the point of "taxing" lanes.  The only "tax" you should get is the xp you get from the minions that die around you while you are ganking/pushing the wave.  Anything over the top of that is kind of pointless as you have your own area to farm gold and xp from. (There are of course exceptions: about to hit 6, laner tells you you can, etc.)

The point is generally a thank you for time invested into a gank, time missed farming, 63 gold in exchange for a flash or kill is great, as long as you again aren't taxing and taking kills (putting lane in a large deficit for your "help" there is nothing wrong with taxing. The way I see it, depending on time invested to the gank you missed 2 or so camps, so giving you 63 gold and the assist gold actually keeps you on par with the enemy JG if they were power farming and cleared 2-4 camps (depending on game timers and clear speed and all kinds of things, most likely 2 camps though). It basically maintains that both the jungle and lane will be ahead, lane because of kill, xp and CS after the kill jungle because of assist gold, 1-3 minions, kill xp as well as some lane XP. It is just a way of turning one persons advantage into multiple people being ahead (though to a slightly smaller scale than say get assist leave and let the lane take everything)
